events.event_description: European Union's natural gas consumption declined 18% from the previous five-year average in 2023, with consumption remaining 19% below average during January-May 2024.
events.citation: In 2023, natural gas consumption in the European Union's 27 member countries (EU-27) declined 18% from the previous five-year (2017–21) average according to Eurostat data. During the first five months of 2024 (January–May), consumption remained 19% below the 2017–21 average for the same months.

events.event_description: European governments implemented mandatory natural gas consumption reduction measures of minimum 15%, which were extended through March 2025.
events.citation: In 2022, after a significant decline of pipeline imports from Russia, European governments enacted coordinated demand-reduction measures. Those measures mandated a minimum 15% reduction in natural gas consumption from August 2022 to March 2023. These policies were subsequently extended through March 2025.

events.event_description: European natural gas storage facilities reached record-high 59% capacity at the end of the heating season.
events.citation: As of April 1, 2024, natural gas storage facilities in Europe were 59% full—the highest percentage on record for the end of a heating season (November 1 through March 31)—according to data from Gas Infrastructure Europe's Aggregated Gas Storage Inventory (AGSI+).

events.event_description: Europe's natural gas pipeline receipts from Russia declined by 89% in 2023 compared to 2021 levels, while LNG imports remained stable at 14.5 Bcf/d.
events.citation: Europe's natural gas pipeline receipts from Russia declined by 58% (6.3 Bcf/d) in 2022 and 89% (9.7 Bcf/d) in 2023, compared with the 2021 annual average. In 2023, LNG imports into EU-27 and the UK averaged 14.5 Bcf/d, remaining essentially unchanged from 2022

events.event_description: Germany added new LNG import facilities in 2023, with 83% of its LNG imports supplied by the United States.
events.citation: LNG import facilities were added in Germany in 2023, and Germany accounted for 5% of all EU-27 and UK imports. Most—83%—of 2023 LNG imports into Germany were supplied by the United States.
